page.title: 11Holborn/Bloomsbury 05300181
page.content: {Holborn Tube Station} forms a convenient centre point for this block with{Southampton Row}to the north,{New {Oxford Street}to the west,{High {Holborn}to the east and{Kingsway}to the south, which divides the block in to four sectors. The{NW}sector contains the majority of the British Museum buildings which house a vast number of exhibits and collections including the National Library. The area around{Great Russell Street}is known for its importance within the literary and publishing world and many publishing companies have offices within this area. Amid the dwellings and offices of the{NE}sector you can find the historic Gray's Inn - one of the four Inns of Court - and also Gray's Inn Gardens designed by Francis Bacon. {continued.....
